intro: Eugenioides ciliatum, commonly known as the velvetleaf or velvetleaf tree, is a tropical plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves that are covered in fine, velvety hairs, giving it a soft texture. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, round capsule that splits open to release seeds. Eugenioides ciliatum is often found in humid, shaded environments in tropical regions.
